sources.title: Machine Gun Mama
sources.description: A comedy about a Brooklyn man and a Mexican circus, with more laughs than plot, but guaranteed to put a smile on your face.

sources.title: Machine Gun Mama
sources.description: Music and laughs surround the adventures of two brash Brooklynites (Wallace Ford, El Brendel) as they try to deliver Bunny the elephant to a Mexican carnival and tangle with the evil "Joe the Gyp," who's trying to close the show. You can find more information regarding this film on its IMDb page .

sources.title: Machine Gun Mama (1944) COMEDY
sources.description:
Stars: Armida, El Brendel, Wallace Ford 
 Director: Harold Young

 Ollie and John are stuck with car trouble. Luckily they have Bunny the elephant. They try to sell him to a fair in financial trouble.

sources.title: Machine Gun Mama (1944) Adventure, Comedy, Romance
sources.description:
Ollie and John are stuck with car trouble. Luckily they have Bunny the elephant. They try to sell him to a fair in financial trouble.

Directors: Harold Young 
Writer:  Sam Neuman
Stars: Armida, El Brendel, Wallace Ford 
Genre: Adventure, Comedy, Romance

metadata.Plot: Ollie and John are a long way from their home in Brooklyn when their truck breaks down. When they run into a fair, they decide to sell their only valuable possession. It's an elephant with the name Bunny, and Ollie has grown really attached to him. At the fair the 'ferocious' Nita Cordoba works and John falls in love with her, the feeling is mutual. Most employees of the fair are willing to buy Bunny, as the fair is in great commercial trouble and an elephant might just be the injection so barely needed. Owner Jose, however, has different ideas. He'd rather see the fair go down as that will be more benificial to him.
